Please stop posting the same question, every couple of hours. Also if you want to cross post between multiple channels place use the url of the first post so it doesn't clutter things up

Totally. You just need to add the properties you want included in the request. The documentation even has. In the read endpoint <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/companies|here >you can add properties and see how the request is built.

I try to pull the invoices. I’m looking at that one here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/migrate-an-existing-account-extension-integration>, but I can not find an endpoint. Does anyone has me a tip?
You can use the crm objects endpoint for this, the object type id is 0-53

Hello! I don't know if this is quite the right channel. I'm trying to create a custom validation in our forms to disallow specific special characters. I need like layman's terms on how to accomplish this! I'm pretty sure I just need to adjust the embed code, but I'm not sure where to begin.

I am trying to get the latest meeting (engagement) details (more than the default contact properties provide) for a particular contact (via email). This seems more convoluted to do with the API than it should be. From what I can tell you need to use the following:

• GET: `/contacts/v1/contact/email/:contact_email/profile` => return a contact object id (`:objectId`)
• GET: `/crm-associations/v1/associations/:objectId/HubSpot_DEFINED/9`
At this point I have a list of engagements for a particular contact... but thats all the engagements - so in order to find out what the correct engagement is (for the latest meeting) I would need to loop through each engagement ID and get its information too. *This A) seems borderline insane, B) would take a ton of requests just to something that should be more accessible.*

Am I missing a more sensible API endpoint here? This can't be the only way to get this information,
